text: So Commanderin’s latest episode has Ben Hayes, lead developer for Rivals on. I’d submitted a few questions, one specifically about whether Etali’s ability (or similar) might make it into Boros commanders. Ben said probably not because this ability is too chaotic for RW, but could show up in BR or UR. So, suck it Boros. More soldiers for you.
white is way too strutured for it’s own good
How about whenever an opponent casts a spell on your turn you can cast a spell from your hand for free?
Of equal or lesser casting cost
That seems pretty white
There could be a more controlled version of cascade but from your hand for white
Where if you play a soldier, you can cast another soldier from your hand
Tribal/coat of arms sort of brotherhood/sisterhood is totally white
it doesn’t really solve the cards-in-hand problem that white tends to have
True
Could then if I cast a soldier, get a soldier from my deck and put in my hand
Reinforcement?
It’s controlled and not random
Honestly, they can explore the [[Alms Collector]] model...

text: Or a rhystic study but instead of cast, if someone attacks.. because someone disrupted the peace >.>
I think Alms Collector is a step in the right direction.
That would do fun things against your Kryphix deck, <@U3QMCLQQG>
It would do fair things against Kruphix.
Or it would try to and I would counter it.
If you could...
It's not like I'm not swimming in cards and mana...
If you tried to BSZ someone for dead, just flash that in the Cavern of Souls
with Cavern...
You send a lot of mana to have each of us draw 1 card...seems fair.
Lol. Cavern is a problem, but come on, did you really name cats?
Probably Clerics
:wink:
If I had that in my deck and playing against K, you're damn right I did!
I do think the lack of draw in white is slightly overblown
Well it’s an issue but it can be dealt with if you’re clever and creative
Really?
I think most mono-white players would disagree with you.
White is super brittle
It’s harder than just jamming Harminize
It's reliant on artifacts.
It is
And it’s also reliant on expensive cards
Or on stilting your deck to favor a strategy that maybe isn't synergistic with your commander or what you want to do.
By definition of them being artifacts, those that draw are overcosted.
So you get to white's other problem - ramp. There are ways, but they're very difficult.
You have pre-"we cared about the color pie" white cards for lands, but they're also fairly expensive.
Land Tax and Scroll Rack should be in every mono white deck, but that’s also 60 bucks
White can still get Plains, that may go to hand these days
They just*
White can make their drops, but not get ahead.

text: The few draw cards in white rely on small creatures or artifacts, equipment and vehicles.
I ran Goggles in a Boros deck strictly to copy Tormenting Voice-type cards and never regretted it

If white were to get card advantage or ramp, that’s a dangerous thing. White weenie’s weakness needs to be that it runs out of steam. There are good reasons for red and white to struggle with drawing cards outside of EDH

if white were to get them, I think the only good way to go about it is with equalizing effects like Sandstone Oracle and Knight of the White Orchid. 

Another good option is the Isperia design. White benefits when other people break the law, so rather like alms collector, it could get some draw based on he actions of its opposition. 

But they do need to be careful with it. It’s the color’s biggest weakness, they can’t play with it too lightly
Oh Henry is right that whites draw is all draw not quite good enough for other colors but I still think that doesn’t make it as terrible as people make out
I wouldn’t run Mind’s Eye in other colors but that doesn’t mean it isn’t pretty effective
Right. Mind's Eye is basically a red or white card because no one else runs it
Honestly, I might consider it in a big-mana deck, simply because I'll have extra mana around and why not turn it into cards?
True
I’ll also admit that my mono white deck has a slight bit of advantage baked in as it’s Djeru whonfetcjes a Walker so that slightly offsets it
Yeah...white can tutor, but that's card selection vs. advantage per say.
selection is not card draw, it’s a card quality improvement
That's what i said! You stop trying to get in the last word, <@U3RJ9VDRT>. If that is your real name...
nope, i’m Henry now
Then, Henry, you have to pay for your kid's school for next fall, so chop, chop.
nope, I’m the henry that could have been without children
Bastard!
but is also very no successful at all
Well in Djeru it actually it advantage because you keep the tutor as a body who can then be blinked etc
But generally yeah it’s not advantage
true
most tutors aren’t though
I’d be down with white getting card advantage from casting legendary permanents. It ties into their belief that they’re better than everyone else
it also put a limit on the advantage they’d be able to get

text: Who casts a big creature into a board where a blue player has 6 mana up?
I use to play it more back in the day. Just seem to be better options these days
It's pretty neat to run cards that are slightly sub-optimal, though. People never see them coming. They're not great most of the time, but when they do get their moment, they're amazing
It doesn’t even have to be that great. Stopping a three drop and drawing three is perfectly fine
And if you’re playing blue you probably have other instants to use if nobody casts a creature. And if people don’t cast big stuff because you have six free then that’s a win too
When you play Possibility Storm all cards become sub optimal. It’s the ultimate leveler
Overload cyclonic rift or a normal bounce card? It’ll all end up on the bottom of the deck equally
who casts an overloaded cyc rift with PS on the table? What are these games you guys are playing? Who are these people!?
Cats and dogs, living together! Mass hysteria!
someone not paying attention is who
The question is who plays with people who regularly cast Possibility Storm
cats and dogs?

There's a group of folks who play at my LGS who always are bugging the shop workers about insane rulings and interactions, one kid was playing Possibility storm and another managed to get a [[knowledge pool]] out. I was never more glad to not be playing with them

text: I just tried Pitiless Plunderer in Meren and was sadly underwhelmed. I think I'd like it in Mazirek a lot though. I've actually been considering changing Meren to Maz
I initially wanted to make him, but could never get him to work, so I defaulted to Meren. Now I have ishai/Reyhan that probably fills the Maz gap, but it's not quite the same
I think Meren's the wrong deck for it... you need a token strategy where you're sacrificing your stuff for value.
Mazirek's a good home too, though that tends to be a pretty linear deck.
oh, thats the real answer, pitiless plunderer and march of machienes into bitter ordeal
Not unless you have a way to stop the loop.
krosan grip!
That doesn't stop it.
thats…. a good point
The loop keeps going based on state-based actions and triggers...
vedalken orrey and rest in peace
can't you Grip the March of the Machines in response to the Pitiless Plunderer trigger?
no, that doesn’t
You can, but split second doesn't stop anything, because these are triggers.
yeah
Right, but before Pitiless Plunderer makes a new batch of Treasures, March will be killed, which means the new Treasures won't immediately die, thus stopping the loop
That should work...
I mean, the previous triggers will all resolve...
but without the effect
Well, I mean you get all of the previous treasures
yup
Related, It is kinda funny how subtly ungrokkable Split Second can be. More than once I've seen someone cast a Grip or a Sudden Spoiling thinking it'll be like a counterspell
Meaning they think the previously cast spell goes away?
Or that it'll be like a Silence, maybe. To be honest I'm not sure what the thought process is there, and it only lasts for a bout a second because they immediately realize that
's not how Split Second works
What really gets folks is when you activate your morph in response to a Split Second card...
It’s such a good effect
I agree...I'd really like to see more Split Second.
I know folks are all about Grip but I’ve seen so many games win or lost w a Sudden Spoiling
spoiling is the real shit
It is indeed.
Damn fine card, that
You can stop Azami players in their tracks and they just look up and say "but Azami!"
Side topic, I'm watching a pauper game, and am amazed how much removal there is at common in black.
it’s kinda silly, isn’t it?
old draft design is silly
It is...rather unfair, honestly.

text: Can anyone tell me what this guy is asking?
Is he asking About the affiliate link?
Something with the Recs tab?
Maybe...to buy the cards? Not sure
Is he beta testing some new deckbuilding feature we don’t know about for some reason because you don’t trust us or like us as much as this rando?
A b testing
NOBODY TELL HENRY

I'm undertaking a fairly easy project that I'd appreciate any help with anyone can provide. I'm trying to figure out how often Exotic Orchard provides colors of mana you need on T1, T5, and T10. I've got a google doc and if anyone wants to have the ability to add entries to it lemme know. I'm gonna try to get 100 or so games.
I SUPPORT THIS PROJECT
Or is T10 too late? Should I do 1, 3, 5, 7?

Well...I mean...so much of what you're tracking has 'it depends' stapled onto it, I'm not sure what you hope it will actually tell you, statistically, beyond what you see in your particular meta based on the popularity of the colors of your decks against the popularity of those colors in decks in your meta.
Ideally you could generate this data. Pull 4 random EDHREC decks, deal out 4 starting hands, etc

I think the most important metrics are probably turns 2 or 3, and turn infinity. Can this land reliably fix your colors in the early game when you need it most, and how often is this land likely to be a Command Tower purely based on the colors of your opposition?
Wouldn't be perfect but if you simmed it 10,000 times you'd get workable numbers

Wouldn't it be a sliding scale based on the popularity of colors on the decks on EDHREC to actually generate the data? IOW, if you have U in your ID, based on the overall popularity of U decks, you'll see it Y % on turn Z, etc.
doesn't work as well if you go first
Yeah, the variables are nightmares. Fetches, Nature's Lore, etc.
The data to run a sim would just be way to hard to bake in
I don't even think you have to go that hard into it, since we're talking probabilities.
Which is why I thought just hard games
Are you looking for it to generate any ONE of your colors or ALL of your colors?
man, that's the kind of data we could have gotten out of the cockatrice project, but it turns out that cockatrice doesn't have an easy way to read game states
How many is probably most important. In a 2 color deck 70% of the time it makes both colors by T3, in a 3 color deck it makes 2 70% of the time and 3 55% etc
At least using real games you can assume people will make choices w their hands to get the maximum array of colors they need on the field

Well...if we can extrapolate on color popularity and say if U is the most popular then if you play blue you have X % chance of it turning on T1/2, then secondary % against Black, Green, etc. I'm not sure how you extrapolate the individual percentages into an overall, based on your 2/3/4/5 colors. It's been 10+ years since I took statistics, but I'm sure <@U3MTAQBE1> or others know the math involved.
I feel like Exotic Orchard is underplayed compared to how often it functionally is an etb untapped dual, tri, Command Tower, etc but I'd just like to roughly see if I can verify that
It's also a card that has probably scaled upwards as people playing the game have matured in their deckbuilding, upgraded land bases, and as the game has added more land options.
I strongly suspect <@U286Q175Y> could get the data you want, but figuring out how to ask the question in a meaningful way is the hard part.
It's also probably a fantastic article should I have some data
im a big fan of exotic orchard
i use it in all 3+ color decks
even simpler... reflecting pool is also woefully underplayed imo
I do too in 3+, and in two there's probably enough options if you've not playing budget where you don't need it. I'd just love some maths, even if they're rudimentary
Reflecting pool is a $10+ card...
maybe someone has already analyzed carpet of flowers, since it's a popular card in cEDH
Pool is also probably a lot easier to quantify since it's based on your own deck
Pool needs another reprint...
And like Henry said at ten bucks it's not a "duh, jam it!" thing like Orchard probably is
oh man
carpet of flowers
i was skeptical of that card
but now...
the thing is insane
I only run it in Sigarda where the downside is it cantrips/enables devotion/powers Sanctum and Ancestral Mask and similar cards. Even outside enchantress though it's probably worth
Well, in cEDH everyone runs Islands, except for Prosh.
So do we think just hard tallying games doesn't provide enough meaningful data to matter?
I'm skeptical, but that's also my nature, so be skeptical of my skepticism.
it can work, but you need to keep a lot of data per game to be able to sift everything out later
what's the average color identity of opponents
who went first
on what turn does a player have a colored mana source
how many opponents played green land ramp (that gives you more colors)
